column4: hi guys! I have a problem with virtualbox and 2 virtual network cards. I run ubuntu server 12.04. I can ping from the host to the guest via 192.168.56.{1,200}, the guest can ping to the ip of google.com, but DNS does not work. What should I do? I think it has to do sth. with /etc/resolv.conf
its ubuntu server 12.04, the host is xubuntu 12.10
what is the contents of resolv.conf
and it states the contents will be overwritten by resolvconf(8)
hrmm. where'd it get that.  ubuntu desktop uses dnsmasq...does ubuntu server not do that?
10.0.2.2 is the host IP of my VirtualBox network
is it running a dns server?
actually it should since other guests OS have DNS
dunno.  no guarantee that the other OS's are using the host for DNS.
for example, I could install a nameserver inside an ubuntu guest and have it provide its own DNS.
can you ping 10.0.2.2 from inside the guest?
connection timed out, no servers could be reached
what other guests do you have?  see if that works in any of those.
I got another linux, there the resol.conf contains nameserver 127.0.0.1 \n search fritz.box
however, dig @127.0.0.1 www.google.com also does not work
